channel.title: 华尔街日报
channel.description: 这是一个追踪华尔街日报news的种子

item.title: 即时新闻：尼基-黑莉将于周三上午暂停总统竞选活动，不会立即为唐纳德-特朗普背书
item.description:
Breaking News: Nikki Haley will suspend her presidential campaign Wednesday morning and won't immediately endorse Donald Trump https://t.co/clqPbIrKBL https://t.co/clqPbIrKBL

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 6, 2024

item.title: 近代以来，美国从未在两位年龄如此之大、反感如此强烈的总统候选人之间做出选择
item.description:
Never in modern times has America had to choose between two presidential candidates so old and so strongly disliked https://t.co/LP7lBOr6Bw https://t.co/LP7lBOr6Bw

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 6, 2024

item.title: 去年夏天，乌克兰突击队登陆苏丹，与俄罗斯支持的民兵组织作战，与瓦格纳准军事组织交战，并破坏莫斯科在该国的利益。乌克兰和俄罗斯之间的战争前线是如何延伸到非洲的：
item.description:
Ukrainian commandos landed in Sudan last summer to fight a Russia-backed militia group, battle with Wagner paramilitaries and undermine Moscow's interests in the country.

How the front line in the war between Ukraine and Russia is extending into Africa: https://t.co/suHt5beNtY

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 6, 2024

item.title: 一位居住在意大利的中国 X 用户躲在一只卡通猫的头像后面，成为中国政府审查机器最有影响力的挑战者之一。
item.description:
Hiding behind a cartoon cat avatar, a Chinese X user based in Italy has become one of the most influential challengers to Beijing’s censorship machine https://t.co/EDPHyvmwj0 https://t.co/EDPHyvmwj0

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 6, 2024

item.title: "沃伦-巴菲特说："我从未见过有人能用 10 亿美元做得更好。93 岁的露丝-戈特曼就是这样利用伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司的股票免去了医学院的学费。
item.description:
"I've never seen anybody behave better with a billion dollars," Warren Buffett says. This is how Ruth Gottesman, 93, made a medical school tuition-free using Berkshire Hathaway stock. https://t.co/Q1zAc7YmJT https://t.co/Q1zAc7YmJT

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 6, 2024

item.title: 杰森-凯尔斯（Jason Kelce）这样的橄榄球人物从未出现过，以后也很可能不会再有。@JasonGay 关于这位深受爱戴的老鹰队中锋和费城体育界传奇人物的传奇经历--以及他的下一步行动。
item.description:
There never has been a football character quite like Jason Kelce, and there likely won’t be again. @JasonGay on the beloved Eagles center and Philadelphia sports legend's legacy—and his next act. https://t.co/0sQgMVgLus https://t.co/0sQgMVgLus

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 6, 2024

item.title: 看到朋友离婚或考虑离婚，这位《青年钱报》专栏作家不得不认真思考自己的感情问题

item.title: 十年前，在比弗利伍德花二三十万美元就能买到一栋房子。现在呢？"你不可能以低于300万美元的价格买到任何一条黄金街道上的地皮"。
item.description:
A decade ago, you could buy a house in Beverlywood for $200,000 to $300,000. Now? “You can’t buy just land on any of the prime streets for less than $3 million." https://t.co/CsaprHD6NG https://t.co/CsaprHD6NG

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 6, 2024

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：Behnam Ben Taleblu 写道：当全世界都在关注伊朗不断扩大的核计划及其恐怖代理人所带来的威胁时，伊朗的弹道导弹计划却在为这两者的扩张提供支持。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: While the world focuses on the threat posed by Iran’s growing nuclear program and its terror proxies, Iran’s ballistic-missile program is underwriting the expansion of both, writes Behnam Ben Taleblu https://t.co/atPUSswnfv https://t.co/atPUSswnfv

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 6, 2024

item.title: 来自 @WSJopinion：最高法院一致决定恢复唐纳德-特朗普在科罗拉多州总统选票上的投票权并不令人意外。但它仍然具有里程碑意义，是宪法和民主战胜党派法律的胜利。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: The Supreme Court’s unanimous decision restoring Donald Trump on Colorado’s presidential ballot is no surprise. But it’s still a landmark, and a victory for the Constitution and democracy over partisan lawfare. https://t.co/AtnDEtNMfL https://t.co/AtnDEtNMfL

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 6, 2024

item.title: 埃隆-马斯克和萨姆-奥特曼之间的法律之争，只是这场掀起人工智能热潮的动荡合作关系中的最新转折。"讨论结束了"
item.description:
The legal battle between Elon Musk and Sam Altman is just the latest twist in a volatile partnership that launched the AI boom. “Discussions are over.” https://t.co/qUzEYQPAAy pic.twitter.com/nNaWWf3KO1

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 6, 2024

item.title: 黛安-范斯坦（Dianne Feinstein）旧参议员席位的决选已经确定：民主党众议员亚当-希夫（Adam Schiff）将于 11 月对阵共和党人、前棒球明星史蒂夫-加维（Steve Garvey）。
item.description:
The runoff for Dianne Feinstein's old Senate seat is set: Democratic Rep. Adam Schiff will face Republican Steve Garvey, a former MLB star, in November https://t.co/OkSaBlqs9T https://t.co/OkSaBlqs9T

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 6, 2024

item.title: 美国众议员科林-阿尔雷德（Colin Allred）是一名前职业橄榄球运动员，后来曾在奥巴马政府工作，他在得克萨斯州的参议院初选中赢得了民主党的提名。他现在将对阵寻求第三次连任的共和党参议员特德-克鲁兹。
item.description:
U.S. Rep. Colin Allred, a former professional football player who later worked in the Obama administration, won the Democratic nomination for Senate in Texas’ primary election. He will now take on GOP Sen. Ted Cruz, who is seeking a third term. https://t.co/ZjdqcHSs2o

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 6, 2024

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：今天，哈马斯清楚地知道他们的六名人质是美国人。但他们仍继续扣押他们。@wjmcgurn 问：这说明了什么？
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: Today Hamas knows full well that six of their hostages are American. Yet they’ve continued to hold them. What does that say about their fear of the U.S.? asks @wjmcgurn. https://t.co/aeuZYna611 https://t.co/aeuZYna611

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 6, 2024

item.title: Netflix 出品的两部纪录片在科学界引起了轩然大波，他们对纪录片作品的可信度提出了质疑
item.description:
Two Netflix documentaries have ignited a firestorm among members of the scientific community who have challenged the credibility of the work https://t.co/LBE1pOqTwE https://t.co/LBE1pOqTwE

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 6, 2024

item.title: "这不公平"。工人们正在失去减肥药物的健康保险保障，因为雇主无法承受这些开支。
item.description:
“It’s just not fair.” Workers are losing health-insurance coverage of weight-loss drugs, because employers can’t sustain the spending. https://t.co/FjNxPT9bH7 https://t.co/FjNxPT9bH7

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 6, 2024

item.title: 前总统唐纳德-特朗普和总统拜登分别在加利福尼亚州的初选中获胜，使两位候选人在 "超级星期二 "的初选中除一地外都处于获胜的边缘。
item.description:
Former President Donald Trump and President Biden won their respective primaries in California, putting both candidates on the cusp of winning in all but one place each on Super Tuesday https://t.co/WroVW3PuIy https://t.co/WroVW3PuIy

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 6, 2024

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：美国共和党再次提升特朗普是在赌博。共和党正在提名一位公众非常熟悉的候选人，而大多数美国人都说他们不喜欢这位候选人。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: The GOP is taking a gamble by elevating Trump one more time. Republicans are nominating a candidate the public knows well—and who most Americans say they don’t like.https://t.co/mrBcIbr0Mo https://t.co/mrBcIbr0Mo

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 6, 2024

item.title: 比特币价格的剧烈波动让一些人欢呼雀跃，而另一些人则为放弃比特币而自责不已
item.description:
Wild fluctuations in the price of bitcoin have left some celebrating windfalls and others kicking themselves for bailing on it https://t.co/MeVpMn3lzn https://t.co/MeVpMn3lzn

item.title: 独生子女越来越普遍。当父母年老时，他们可能会面临沉重的负担。

Only children are becoming more common. They can face a heavy load when parents get older. https://t.co/NUynH6GkOm https://t.co/NUynH6GkOm

item.title: 尼基-黑莉赢得佛蒙特州共和党初选，这是她首次在该州获胜

Nikki Haley wins the GOP primary in Vermont, marking her first state victory https://t.co/nzQ5XpJp0K https://t.co/nzQ5XpJp0K
